alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 2:56AM EST until January 04 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, around one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, breaking waves of 7 to 8 feet in the surf zone. * WHERE...The bay and ocean side of Northampton County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 5 AM EST early this morning. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 AM this morning to 3 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Shallow flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline resulting in a low threat of property damage. Expect around one foot of water above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks and lawns near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Large breaking waves of 7 to 8 feet will result in dangerous surf conditions. Do not enter or approach the water due to the risk of being swept away.
info.instruction: A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area...producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. A Coastal Flood Advisory means that onshore winds...wave action and/or tides will combine to create flooding of low areas along the shore...and near tidal rivers and creeks. Be prepared for the possibility of road closures and minor flooding of properties. If travel is necessary...do not attempt to drive through water of unknown depth.
